content.title: Apply for a divorce
content.useThisService: You can use this service to apply for a divorce in England and Wales.
content.applyScotland: Divorces in Scotland and Northern Ireland are handled by the courts there.
content.divorceTime: It usually takes 4 to 6 months to get a divorce if it's 'uncontested' (your husband/wife doesn't defend the divorce).
content.marriedOneYear: You must have been married for at least one year before you can apply for a divorce in England and Wales.
content.englishTranslation: have a certified English translation of your marriage certificate if it isn’t written in English
content.originalMarriageCertificate: have your original marriage certificate or a certified copy (order a copy online).
content.respondentAddress: have an address for your husband or wife
content.nameChange: have proof of your name change if you’ve changed it since you got married - this will be either your marriage certificate or other proof (a deed poll for example)
content.onlyOneGround: only want to use one reason (legally known as a 'fact') for the irretrievable breakdown of your marriage
content.costs: The court fee for all divorces in England and Wales is £{{ applicationFee.fee_amount }}.
content.needToPayOnline: You need to pay online by debit or credit card to use this service.
content.getHelp: you get help paying the fee (for those with little or no savings, are on certain benefits or have a low income). Apply online before you start if you think you're eligible
content.theyPay: your husband/wife pays the fee (the court can order them to do so)
content.extra: You'll have to pay more if:
content.respondentDefends: your husband or wife defends the divorce
content.deliverPapers: the divorce papers can't be delivered to them
content.changeApplication: you have to change your application
content.children: Making child arrangements if you divorce or separate
content.money: Money and property when a relationship ends
content.moreIn: in Marriage, civil partnership and divorce
content.cookie: This service uses cookies to make the site simpler.
content.checkIfApplyOnline: Check if you can apply online
content.youCanUseApplyOnline: You can apply online if you:
content.needToSendApplyOnline: You'll need to send your marriage certificate and other documents to the court, either by uploading a digital photo or scan, or by post. Your marriage certificate won't be returned to you. The court can only process your divorce application once it has received your documents and payment.
content.alsoApplyApplyOnline: If you can't apply online, you can apply by filling in the paper D8 form.
